resources.string: Now move app and click again to drop \n(Press RETURN to CANCEL)
Now move app and click to drop \n(Press RETURN to CANCEL)
Restrict access to your children. READ CAREFULLY THE FOLLOWING POPUP before confirmation; it contains all instructions about this option.

ATTENTION! READ CAREFULLY INSTRUCTIONS BELOW, OR YOU WON\'T BE ABLE TO REVERT FROM CHILD MODE TO NORMAL MODE UNLESS YOU HAVE LEFT A WAY TO CHANGE DEFAULT LAUNCHER, OR YOU ARE UP TO USE ADB AND UNINSTALL THIS APP.
Important note for Child Mode to work correctly:

Please be sure that "Don't keep activities" setting in SYSTEM>MANAGE>ADVANCED>DEVELOPER OPTIONS is enabled. If not, Child Mode will continue to work, but with a caveat: If one call "System Menu" right from the launcher, and so launch a game in "You May Also Like" section, everything else (apps and services) is killed by Android, so Child Mode will be disable until the user get back to HEYA.

Open the "About" Dialog in "Settings" section. While opened, you must touch/click every screen corner, using your Ouya Controller touch area or some USB mouse. You won\'t have any visual clues when you touch a corner successfully, but you must hear a "click" sound when doing that in each corner, so pay attention to the sounds. If the launcher restarts, it means you are in Normal Mode again. If not, you can reopen "About" Dialog as often as necessary.
Child Mode will restrict the following:
- Hidden Games/Apps list will be applied.
- "Show System Apps" won\'t be applied, so this apps won\'t be accessible.
- App settings overlay will be disabled.
- Inside "System", "Ouya Function Screens" category will be hidden.
- Inside "Settings", "Games & Apps Listing Settings", "Parental Controls" and "Import / Export" categories will be hidden.

- On "System Menu" overlay, "Ouya Home" will revert back to HEYA Launcher screen after a while (usually one second - works better if you haven\'t entered on stock launcher before). A caveat: disabling Child Mode may throw you back to stock launcher, if "Ouya Home" was used in some moment or if any app/game was launched through "You May Also Like" on System Menu Overlay section.

- On Ouya System Overlay menu, one won\'t be able to launch or download any game/app on "You May Also Like" section. Any game/app launched will revert back to current game/app after a while (usually one second). Downloads will be deleted and those actions will be warned. Two caveats: 1) disabling Child Mode may allow previously denied downloads, so you must enter stock launcher and cancel them all. 2) This routine searchs for any APKs (files with .apk extension) on SDCard and USBDrive roots, so DON\'T SAVE ANY APKs YOU WANT TO BACKUP DIRECTLY INTO THESE DIRECTORIES. Create a folder and save those files inside.
Child Mode Observer App not installed! Please install it before trying to enable Child Mode.
App that is started on HEYA startup.
Show also system apps in app list.
Games and Apps that shall not be shown in apps list, while in Child Mode.
Auto select the first icon when switching to the Games & Apps screen.
Set a custom background image / wallpaper for HEYA.
Customize launcher\'s name to any name you want.
Write below desired launcher name. For reverting back to default name, just leave the field blank. The name can\'t be bigger than 32 characters, otherwise it will be cropped.
Size between 0 and 200 (in DPI) of app list icons. Set to 0 for default.
Size between 0 and 200 (in DPI). Set to 0 for default.
Export current HEYA settings to ZIP-File.
Import HEYA Settings from ZIP-File. Be sure to only import trusted ZIP-Files!
HEYA alternative launcher by Fabr√≠cio Ramos Pereira.\nUsername @ Ouyaforum(http://ouyaforum.com): frpnit\nemail: frpnit@gmail.com
- Firestarter (Non-Root Launcher Replacement / App-Drawer for Amazon FireTV)\nhttps://github.com/sphinx02/FireStarter
- Android Holo Colors Generator site for UI general elements customization\nhttp://android-holo-colors.com/
- Custom Listpreference (base for all custom dialogs) from Reinier post @ http://stackoverflow.com/a/14790665
- Baxylauncher source code for some specific functions, like loading Ouya game icons\nhttps://github.com/frankkienl/BaxyLauncherOUYA/blob/master/src/nl/frankkie/baxy/
- And countless helping posts from StackOverflow, without it I couldn\'t have solved many, many problems and doubts that appeared during all development\nhttp://stackoverflow.com.
- Ouyaforum nice and supportive people - specially Eldon McGuinness for answers, for sending me Controller Pairing source code, and for some more (direct or indirect) guidance.
